meanings.definition: A person who upholds or adheres to traditional values or practices.
meanings.sent1: Many traditionalists prefer celebrating holidays in the same way each year.
meanings.sent2: The traditionalists in the village always gather for the annual harvest festival.
meanings.sent3: The traditionalists decided to have a potluck dinner with a twist - everyone had to wear costumes!
meanings.sent4: In a world of change, traditionalists stand like ancient oaks, rooted in the past.
meanings.sent5: The traditionalists' dedication to customs is as strong as a fortress, unwavering and enduring.

meanings.definition: Those who resist or reject modern or innovative ideas or methods.
meanings.sent1: Some traditionalists believe that new technology is unnecessary and prefer old-fashioned ways.
meanings.sent2: The traditionalists at the meeting were skeptical of the proposed changes.
meanings.sent3: The traditionalists chuckled at the idea of using drones for farming - they preferred good old tractors.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of progress, traditionalists are like lighthouses, warning of the dangers of change.
meanings.sent5: The traditionalists' aversion to change is as solid as a mountain, unmoving and resolute.
